Case reference: 2006024399.CaseDesc: Mark Cornett was last seen at Missinaibi Lake, 1.0 kilometre north of Fairy Point in Missinaibi Township. He was involved in a boating accident on his way back from fishing and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014003051.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1991, Yannick Fortin, age 6, was last seen playing by himself in the backyard of the family residence in Matawin. The backyard of the house overlooks the St. Maurice River. Searches were conducted in the area but Yannick was never seen again.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2014005517.CaseDesc:
At the time of her disappearance, Amber Guiboche was living in the north end of Winnipeg with her boyfriend and his family. Amber had been leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Amber spent the evening of November 10th, 2010 socializing with friends. Later that evening she went to a friend’s residence on Bushnell St. She left there alone at around 11:45 p.m., and walked to the intersection of Isabel Street and William Ave.  

She was picked up there shortly after by a man driving a burgundy pickup truck. The truck was described as an older, burgundy Chevrolet Silverado, extended cab, short box with a “4x4” decal toward the rear of the box. 

The truck was last seen traveling southbound on Isabel St. It was captured on video in the area in which she was last seen.

Images of this truck and a forensic artist’s sketch of the driver have been made available.

Case reference: 2015041172.CaseDesc: Helen Leyden was last heard from by her family sometime between 1968 and 1972. She was living in Edmonton, but is thought to have possibly gone to Vancouver during this time.

Case reference: 2006013399.CaseDesc: Dustin Rhodes has been missing from the area of Timmins, Ontario since July 6, 1991.  He was last seen around 11:00 a.m. on that day near his cottage on Gibson Lake.  His truck was found at that location but Mr. Rhodes has not been seen since.

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Blue, Grey or blue work pants

Case reference: 2012020004.CaseDesc: Jafar Imenpour, 74 years of age, who was visiting the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia from Iran, was reported missing on September 25, 2011.  Mr. Imenpour had not returned to his family residence after he had left for a 15 minute walk in Port Coquitlam, B.C. He does not speak English and does not know anyone other than his family in this area.

Case reference: 2006009199.CaseDesc: On July 09, 2003, Michael Linklater, his father and brother went to the Linklater family hunting & fishing camp; located near mile marker 115 on ONR Railroad line, between Cochrane and Moosonee. Mr. Linklater left the camp at about 6:00 a.m. on July 13, 2003, and has not been seen since. His father and brother searched for hours before going to mile marker 126 and calling the police. An extensive search in the area has failed to locate Mr. Linklater.

Case reference: 2021007962.CaseDesc: Robert Hutchison was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. On January 30, 2021, Robert contacted his family for the last time. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Left Wrist, Birthmark red dots under wrist
Scar: Shoulders, Several scars on right shoulder (clavicle)

Case reference: 2014002585.CaseDesc: Mario Levasseur was last seen leaving the family home on December 1, 1983, in Levis, Quebec.

Case reference: 2020011692.CaseDesc: Joyce MacDougall was last heard from on March 13, 1986, at approximately 7:30pm. Joyce telephoned her mother to inform her that she was going out for a few drinks, but she never returned home. On March 14, Joyce interacted with the police in Niagara Falls and during the course of the interaction she was issued a ticket and was taken to a restaurant. She was last seen at the restaurant by a server and had left her purse in the restaurant.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the left side of the cheek

Case reference: 2020028832.CaseDesc: On July 8th 2020, Tammy Nattaway was last seen in the north end of Garden Hill First Nation.

Case reference: 2014003711.CaseDesc: Between May 25 and June 2, 1978, Gerry Maurice Gascon received the services of the Algoma Hospital in the City of Greater Sudbury. He has not been in contact with anyone since his release from Algoma Hospital.  Gerry usually wears blue jeans, a black leather jacket and cowboy boots.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2015036270.CaseDesc: Brian Franko was last seen on July 10, 2015, walking away from the Saskatchewan Hospital.  He did not appear to be in a good frame of mind.  Brian was walking toward the South Saskatchewan River when he was last seen.  Extensive searches were conducted, with no success.

Case reference: 2014005039.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Azim Ramji was seen for the last time as he left his home in Kitchener, Ontario, after telling his family that he was leaving for Niagara Falls. Later that day, Azim’s vehicle was found at the Skylon Tower in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Azim was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004103.CaseDesc: Michelle Gurney was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver at the St. James Community Society building on December 11, 1998. She was reported missing ten days later. Ms. Gurney was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and had mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014005727.CaseDesc: Ryan Slobodzian was last seen when he was dropped off on Henry Avenue. Mr. Slobodzian has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Backpack: Unknown, May have been carrying at time of disappearance

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2012020095.CaseDesc: On February 21, 2006, between 8:00 and 8:30 am Draper Jim was dropped off on the road by the Health Center on the Saulteaux First Nation (North of Cochin, Saskatchewan). Draper was attempting to return home to the Witchekan First Nation and has not been seen since.

Scar: Lower Lip, Left side of lower lip
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Ying Yang Symbol

Case reference: 2014003940.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1999, Dana Zelic was seen for the last time at her mother's residence located in Hamilton, Ontario. Dana was known to have connections in the Greater Toronto area and in Brooklyn, New York, in the United States. At the time of her disappearance, Dana left her mother’s home without her medication, identification or personal belongings. All efforts to locate her have returned negative results.

Mark: Left Side Of Neck, Brown beauty mark

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2014004533.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1985, Jonathan Molina was seen for the last time in a vehicle in the White Bear First Nation near Carlyle, Saskatchewan. The following year, on October 1, 1986, the skeletal remains of Jonathan’s mother and infant sibling were found in close proximity of the vehicle. Searches to find Jonathan have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2016034844.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2016, Derwin Beardy was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Derwin was leading a transient lifestyle.

Shirt: Cotton, Red, White, Red t-shirt with white lettering across back, white emblem left chest

Case reference: 2014002983.CaseDesc: On the 14th of June, 1986, Joseph MAJOR, 75 years old, was reported missing from a care home in the Hudson Bay district, SK. Extensive ground searches of the area failed to locate Joseph.

Case reference: 2019002992.CaseDesc: On August 25, 2018, Anupama Nadagouda was seen for the last time with her daughter, Anvita Mulemane, in India.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 1984142670.CaseDesc: On January 20, 1983, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Tania Murrell was seen for the last time as she left school to return home.

Case reference: 2014001015.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 30 years old, was found in the County of Wellington on the grounds of a private club called "Clearwater Enterprises Ltd.". His post-mortem length was measured at 5’8”-5’10”, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was a heavy smoker. He was estimated to have been there since August-late September the previous year.

Other: Single blade pocket knife with inscription "Niagara Falls"

Case reference: 2014001606.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1986, Sarah Pelletier was last seen in Montreal, Québec. Witnesses saw her jump off the Jacques-Cartier Bridge into the Saint-Lawrence River at approximately 9:00 p.m. Sarah hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004183.CaseDesc: Virginia Sampare was last seen on October 14, 1971. Ms. Sampare was despondent over the death of her boyfriend. Ms. Sampare left the residence in the evening of that date and was not seen again.

Shirt: Cotton, Short sleeve navy blue shirt

Case reference: 2006027999.CaseDesc: On August 15, 1986 Clayton Duncan McFaul was last seen by a family member on the family farm near Havelock Ontario. Mr. McFaul was completing his usual daily farm chores. He was very punctual about meal times, so when he failed to arrive for his lunch his family were concerned. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. McFaul.  Several possible sightings were reported after August 15, 1986, but none led to Mr. McFaul's location.

Hair: Bald, White, Other, Bald with fringe

Case reference: 2014003894.CaseDesc: Jean Gravel and Jean-Guy Champagne were employees of the Rio Bar in downtown Trois-Rivières. On July 6, 1972, they arrived at work in the early evening; they were to work there until closing. They never returned home and have not been seen since. They were reported missing on July 10, 1972.

Jewelry: Gold, ring on the left ring finger
Silver, wedding ring on the left ring finger

Case reference: 2012020072.CaseDesc: Claudette Osborne (born Tyo) was last seen leaving the Lincoln Motor Hotel on McPhillips Street in Winnipeg, Manitoba on the morning of 25 July 2008.

Hair: Brown, Blonde, Straight, Long, Bottom 12" dyed blonde

Case reference: 2008015399.CaseDesc: Ronald Desmeules was living in Red Lake, Ontario. While working through some personal issues, Mr. Desmeules traveled to Squamish, British Columbia in September of 1995. On September 14, 1995, while staying with family, he left their residence, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017060723.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2017, Amber Barlow was last seen in the area of 107 Street and 152 Avenue, Edmonton, Alberta.  Amber engages in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014005339.CaseDesc: Gilles Lacroix, a priest, was last seen on August 31, 2009 in Boucherville, Quebec. He was living in Longueuil, Quebec. Gilles left in his vehicle and his vehicle was later found on September 5, 2009.

Case reference: 2012020662.CaseDesc: Marc April was last seen at approximately 6:30 p.m. on January 31, 1987, at the Saskatoon City Hospital, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Marc was a patient at a hospital at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014000015.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2012 Allan Kinkaid was reported missing to the Calgary Police Service. Mr. Kinkaid had moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 2006. He last had contact with his family in Calgary on December 25, 2009.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Other, Blonde patch, medium length

Case reference: 2011003099.CaseDesc: Brian Dunlop was dropped off in the downtown area of North Bay, Ontario by his father on the morning of June 2, 1994.  His family has not been in contact with him since that time.  In August of 1994, Brian was seen in North Bay and Oshawa, Ontario by people who knew him. This is the last time he was seen by anyone.

Case reference: 2014004726.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1992, Brenda Wilson was last seen at her residence in Moncton, New Brunswick. She lived alone and all of her personal belongings were left behind. At the time of her disappearance, Brenda was despondent.

Case reference: 1996003690.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1994, Angela Arseneault was reported missing by her common law spouse. She was last seen on August 19, 1994, they and another male went shopping. Later that day, Angela left to catch a bus home alone. When her common law spouse returned home, the lights were on in the apartment, a window was left open and Angela’s purse was in the kitchen. Angela has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, rose and stem (6 inches long)

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2016061229.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1973, a male individual was found on the GO Train tracks near Roncesvalles and the Gardiner, beneath the Sunnyside Walkway, from which he apparently fell/jumped. His post-mortem length was 5’5"-5’8", but due to extensive bone fractures this may not accurately reflect his height. His appendix was not present.

Hair: Short, Straight, Dark, straight hair approximately 2-3" in length
Shirt: Grey, Patterned, may have been blue and white

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2014001301.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1999, Harold Donald Maskell was reported missing by his cousin Mike Viger. Harold’s cousin had come to visit him at his residence in Coles Island, New Brunswick, but there was no sign of him at the house. A search of the shoreline of the Canaan River returned negative results. Harold does not drive and cannot walk very far.

Shirt: Red, Plaid, Plaid; red, white, blue

Case reference: 2008004699.CaseDesc: Adave Francis was last seen October 12, 1999, at 6:00 p.m. riding his bicycle on the farm property located at Poplar side road in the Collingwood area. Mr. Francis was a seasonal worker from Jamaica.

Case reference: 2019015560.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2019, Donna Paré was reported missing in Montreal, Quebec. Donna last communicated with her family in December 2018, and is known to live a transient lifestyle. She is known to frequent the Berri-UQAM and Place-des-Arts metro stations, and the McDonald’s on Sainte-Catherine Street East and Berri Park in Montreal, Quebec. Donna’s family has reason to fear for her health and safety.

Case reference: 2006025799.CaseDesc: Anthony Roberts was last seen driving his vehicle east on King Street in Prescott, Ontario, on January 8, 1996. He was reported missing on January 19, 1996, and has not been heard from or seen since that time.

Case reference: 2012020051.CaseDesc: Emily Ballantyne departed Lynn Lake the evening of April 27, 1991, heading to Thompson, MB with two male acquaintances. It is believed the trio arrived in Thompson late that evening, and they went their separate ways.  Ms Ballantyne has not been seen since and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: White, blue and pink on shoulder and elasticized waist

Case reference: 2014005495.CaseDesc: David Harrison Powell went missing on September 22, 2010. David was last seen leaving his residence. His vehicle and other important property were left behind.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Ankle, Unhealed fracture, Walks with a limp

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2013000127.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2011, Howard Graveline was reported missing from his home in the Limbour district in Gatineau, Quebec. Howard left his vehicle, passport and wallet behind. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014005251.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2009, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Fabio Dapello was seen for the last time by his father as he left to go to work. When Fabio’s father returned home, both he and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2014001425.CaseDesc: On August 3rd, 1986, RCMP received a report of a missing person. The manager of Sickle Lake Lodge called advising Mr. Hrynick went missing in the early morning hours. Mr. Hrynick was with friends during the evening before and into the early morning. According to them, Mr. Hrynick had been very quiet over the couple days leading up to his disappearance. The evening of his disappearance, Mr. Hrynick was described as intoxicated. At one point, witnesses observed him stumbling on his way out the door of the cabin. The other men went out to search for Mr. Hrynick about 15 minutes later. They could hear a boat but could not see Mr. Hrynick. The empty boat was located the following day. An extensive land and water search failed to locate Mr. Hrynick. There was no indication that Mr. Hrynick found his way to the shore and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006020199.CaseDesc: Christopher Nemmers was last seen on August 11, 1992 on the Sturgeon River. He was going to drain water from a boat and was heard calling for help, then seen slipping under the water. He is presumed drowned and his body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993 in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island. Steven was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2014003107.CaseDesc: Jean Fournier was last seen in Montreal on August 30, 1993. He was very stressed and depressed. He left a letter for his wife stating that he was leaving all of his belongings to her. He left his house with little money in his pocket.

Sweater: Cotton, Cream, Ivory, Black, black stripes

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 2014021185.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2005, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Kim-Marie Kinsella was seen for the last time in the area of 1695 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020112.CaseDesc: On February 14 2007, Philippe Lajoie was seen for the last time in Saint-Didace in the Lanaudière region, Quebec. He left his parents’ home at approximately 6 p.m. to go to a pig farm located on Petite-Rivière Nord road, in Yamachiche in the Mauricie region of Quebec. His vehicle was found there the next day.

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Backpack: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Mountain Equipment Coop
Glasses: Bronze, octagon shaped, wire rimmed, prescription
Shoes: Black, sandals; velcro straps; size 9; navy blue, grey and black swirls

Case reference: 2014001952.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1980, James Neckoway and a friend left Bird, Manitoba by canoe to go hunting and fishing. They intended to travel down the Limestone River, and then down the Nelson River. The canoe in which the men were travelling and the body of Mr. Neckoway's friend were recovered on September 23. Mr. Neckoway has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014003305.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1987, Wade Stanley Saxton was seen for the last time as he left his residence in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010003999.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday May 28, 1999, Tammy Lamondin, age 20,  was with friends on Main Street in Newmarket. She remained in their company until sometime after midnight. In the early morning hours of May 29, 1999, Tammy left the Newmarket area with a male acquaintance. She was not seen again. The police conducted an investigation but were not able to locate her.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Dolphin above right ankle

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2014001814.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1973, between 2:00pm and 5:00pm Steve Mysick packed a suitcase and left the residence where he was staying, located in Rapid City, Manitoba. Steve Mysick was an outpatient of the Brandon Mental Hospital and had been staying with his friends for 2.5 years at the time of his disappearance.   Mr. Mysick was last seen at the CP train station in Brandon, Manitoba. It is likely Mr. Mysick purchased the ticket to Winnipeg as he had very limited funds available and had lived in Winnipeg in the past. There is no indication if Mr. Mysick actually boarded the train to Winnipeg.   Steve Mysick has never been located and his whereabouts is unknown. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2014002505.CaseDesc: On January 27, 1988, Lisa Somerton was seen for the last time outside of her residence located at 1220 Merivale Road in Ottawa, Ontario. She was observed approaching a black sports car with two people inside.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2014004619.CaseDesc: William "Billy Jay" Sharphead was last seen leaving his residence on the Enoch Cree Nation in Alberta, in September of 2003.  On that night it is believed that he got into a car.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Paul and Richard are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014004406.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1973, Caroline Burns was last seen in the early morning leaving her residence in Molanosa, SK. Molanosa is a small isolated community approximately 70 kilometers south of La Ronge, SK. Extensive searches of the area at the time failed to reveal any trace of Ms. Burns.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Missing left top molar and left front tooth
Mark: Right Knee, Burn mark on side of either left or right knee

Case reference: 2014003825.CaseDesc: Ruby Ann Hardy was reported missing by her brother in 2002. She was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver in June 1997, and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014001203.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, the body of a man was found in the ice of the St. Lawrence River near the Parc des Rapides in Lasalle. The man was not wearing winter clothes. A lighter in the right front pocket of his jeans was found.

Sweater: color burgundy with a collar and a zipper

Case reference: 2013000022.CaseDesc: Shenchiu "Andy" Tsou was last seen at the Halifax Casino on June 26, 2005 in Nova Scotia. He was known as a regular client at the casino. Andy was travelling from Richmond, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2014006533.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1983, William Fosseneuve, Raymond Sewap and another person were aboard a boat on the Amisk Lake in Saskatchewan. During the course of their trip to Denare Beach, the trio encountered turbulent waters, which caused William to fall overboard. In an attempt to rescue him, Raymond dove into the water. Both men were last seen submerged in the water.

Case reference: 2019050942.CaseDesc: On August 16, 2019, Aaron Wuttunee was seen for the last time in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. During the time of his disappearance, Aaron had mentioned to an acquaintance that he may hitchhike to Edmonton, Alberta. There is also a possibility that he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia, but it has not been confirmed. Aaron is known for leading a transient lifestyle, and suffered from a brain injury that causes short term memory loss and makes him prone to falling.

Case reference: 2022016834.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2022, Shawn Miness was seen for the last time doing renovations in a residence in Portage la Prairie, Manitoba. A week prior to his disappearance, Shawn’s mother passed away, and he was despondent.

Case reference: 2006019699.CaseDesc:
Pierre Couture was last seen in Cowansville, Quebec. He may have been hiding from
authorities and has not been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2013000111.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1954, Clifford Edward Sherwood Thorne was seen for the last time at the family residence in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Clifford left home to go to school and was never seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021000139.CaseDesc: On January 1st, 2021, Zachery Lefave was last seen around 12:30 a.m., talking on a cellular phone while walking on Highway # 334 in the Plymouth region of Yarmouth County, Nova Scotia. Zachery had left a New Year’s Eve party that was being held in the area.

Case reference: 2014004474.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1987, Lillian Kotyk was last seen when she left her home in Edmonton, Alberta. Lillian has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002041.CaseDesc: Sometime over the night of November 19 to 20, 1999, Mathieu Parent was seen for the last time leaving the Dagobert night club in Quebec, Quebec. His family has not heard from him since.

Pants: Nylon, Dark Blue, With white lines on the sides
Shoes: Blue, Yellow, With fluorescent yellow lines
Sweater: Cotton, Light Blue, Fubu, Long sleeves

Case reference: 2023017319.CaseDesc: On April 8th, 2017 Kurt Beehler was last observed in the area of the Rainbow Bridge, Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, Kurt was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross on inside of forearm

Case reference: 2012020661.CaseDesc: Darlene Anderson was last seen leaving the Hantleman Building at the Royal University Hospital in Saskatoon on November 6, 2006 at 8:00 pm.

Case reference: 2014003748.CaseDesc: On September 29th, 1996, police were contacted by a friend to report his 3 hunting partners, including Glen Mymryk who were overdue from a hunting trip. He also advised he found one of the barrels from the boat they took, floating towards shore and he could see something on the lake through the binoculars but was unsure what it was. The three men left in a loaded boat and got halfway to their destination when they decided the water conditions were too bad and they turned around. The men were bailing but the waves were too much, the motor stalled and they capsized. Mr. Mymryk was last seen floating away soon after the boat capsized. The lone survivor was rescued 7 hours after the incident and indicate the other 2 men he was with had drowned.

Case reference: 2014004546.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2004, Roy Lewis was last seen hitchhiking in Sackville, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2013000145.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Ralph Simington. He was last seen in Calgary, Alberta on June 15, 2012.

Case reference: 2014005741.CaseDesc: Joseph Angus Morin had been living in Sturgeon Landing, Saskatchewan but left in December 2011, to take up residence in Wanless, MB. Joseph frequently traveled between the communities in the immediate area and was last seen in Cranberry Portage on or about January 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2014002244.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Giuseppe Ciancio was seen for the last time at the Beaches Pub in the Saint-Laurent District of Montreal, Quebec. On that evening, Giuseppe left the bar with a friend in a beige Dodge Caravan. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020071.CaseDesc: Richard Tssessaze's last known residence was in Brandon, Manitoba.  He had previously lived in both Thompson and lac Brochet.  Richard was last seen in downtown Winnipeg in the area of the St. Regis Hotel, located on Smith Street, in late June of 2009.  Since that time, Richard has not been seen or heard from, and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2018041224.CaseDesc: Ashley Morin was last seen leaving a house in North Battleford, Saskatchewan on July 10, 2018. Ashley left the house on foot, and has not been in contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2012020116.CaseDesc: On April 1, 1975, Sylvie Ouimet left the Albert-Prevost institution, where she was hospitalized, without any of her personal effects. Her family has not heard from her since.

Scar: Ears, Surgical scar behind the ear

Case reference: 2024017079.CaseDesc: Dean Mattinas was last seen on March 18, 2024, walking west along Highway 11 in Constance Lake First Nation, Ontario. Dean has a history of high-risk behavior and may have been feeling despondent. He is thought to have been hitchhiking west towards Thunder Bay, Ontario.

Backpack: Synthetic, Beige, Tan, With white writing
Hat: Blue, Baseball, Toronto Maple Leafs logo
Luggage: Black, Duffel bag, possible Under Armour brand

Case reference: 2014002164.CaseDesc: Michael Strang was last seen November 21, 1990. Strang was a patient at Centracare psychiatric hospital where he reportedly left from a 3rd story window. Strang has not been heard from since.

Tattoo: Winged Heart - not sure which arm

Case reference: 2005002199.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1980, a Caucasian male was found at a campsite (Lot 19, Con 8, Peck Township) on Hardwood Lookout Trail in Algonquin Park. The death is estimated to have occurred between July 1, 1971 and Spring 1978.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Possibly in a ponytail
Belt: 36 inch, wear shown at 32 inch hole
Other: A folding camp stove; and an aluminum camper's pot with a lid
A black down-filled sleeping bag with a nylon outer shell
Wallet: Black, with 8 cent stamp issues between July 1, 1971 and September 1, 1976
